text: Which means Trump wins because they're working hard to make it impossible to do a fair and valid count. I suggest watching this week's episode of Jon Oliver for more context on that.

elements.text: Which means Trump wins because they're working hard to make it impossible to do a fair and valid count. I suggest watching this week's episode of Jon Oliver for more context on that.

root.text: Because I'm the self-appointed ~pest~ social co-ordinator, a reminder that there will be a few of us gathering *tonight at <https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Restaurant_Review-g186338-d10043084-Reviews-The_Crown-London_England.html|The Crown, 51 New Oxford Street, WC1A 1BL>, from around 5:30-6pm* for a few hours. Just turn up, no need to register or any of that faff. We'll be easy to spot. Or rather, I'm easy to spot: look for the large, bald bloke pointing at everything and whispering mystically "Look at the _alpha_ in that _lightbulb!_ And what about _this beer mat_? Wooaaah!".

text:
Topics for this meetup included:
• the philosophical nature of Justified True Beliefs and Gettier in the context of open discussion of "alpha"
• almost _passionate_ disagreement on the quality of Nate Silver's knowledge, beliefs, and ability as a writer
• <@U05REBJ21EC> honourably deciding to test the legality of trading on crypto prediction markets in the US from the UK for the rest of us - we'll send you a file in a cake if you end up in a Supermax Lorenzo, go for it, haters gonna hate!
• is the real alpha just starting your own exchange?
• dumb ideas that seem to make money, even though they're so obvious they _have_ to be just dimes in front of a steamroller, no?
• how much to invest in smart ideas that don't seem to make money because it _must_ just be the parameter search hasn't hit yet (aka, the source of all imposter syndrome in this domain)
• whether going to Rules for dinner is worth it (probably, yes - speak to <@UBS7QANF3> if you wish to join)
• would horse racing be the second largest spectator sport in the UK if it weren't for Cheltenham festival?
• undocumented forbidden stake amounts at certain price points created by rounding errors
• and, inevitably, "taxes are bad mmm'kay?", as a means to get a rise out of your local Northern Labour-voting cryptosocialist (:wave:)
Next one will be in a few weeks. Probably. I dunno. You figure it out.

text: Unsurprisingly we're going for dinner on 18th December. There's 10 of us as <@U05REBJ21EC> will be joining. I need to pay a NON-REFUNDABLE £1000 deposit to secure the room. I'll send you all my bank details privately for your £100 share of the deposit. If it turns out you cannot make it, I will do my very best to fill your place with someone else so I can return your share to you but there's guarantee I'll be able to do this

text:
He's 1.69 today, 59%.  Doesn't make any sense to me. Silver is hard to fathom, he's certainly good at self promotion but I'm not sure about his predictions..... On Americast he said the outcome will be indicted by the Nov 4th Pensilvania poll, that's not exactly what I'd call million dollar insight. :face_with_rolling_eyes:

I can't comment on what he's posting on X. I deleted Twitter the day Musk took over. He's always been deeply unpleasant.

text:
... And 45mins later it's back to 1.73.  :thinking_face:
He wins: chaos, Ukraine support stops, Putin empowered (and NASA is toast). 
He loses: chaos, Putin runs out of money in 2025. 

The rubber necking is fun but the fallout (possibly literally) certainly isn't.

Spoiler alert: I managed to make contact with him, I think, and he blocked me after a few minutes. Sensitive

text:
I generally believe in price discovery and markets finding their own levels. We know if he pushed the price into 1.1 we'd be pushing it back out. 

Generally speaking Poly been slightly ahead of the polls so I put some of it down to that rather than market manipulation.

elements.text:
I generally believe in price discovery and markets finding their own levels. We know if he pushed the price into 1.1 we'd be pushing it back out. 

Generally speaking Poly been slightly ahead of the polls so I put some of it down to that rather than market manipulation.

text: I think in this case being ahead of the polls might actually be coincidence, but I guess we will see in the next week or so if the polls catch up

elements.text: I think in this case being ahead of the polls might actually be coincidence, but I guess we will see in the next week or so if the polls catch up

text: I’m also not convinced it’s deliberate manipulation, I think it’s a more likely to be whale who won through variance being on their side in the past and believing their own BS.
